result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

02:19 PM Defendant Shamar E Smith appeared by Zoom with attorney Mary Cole who appeard by Zoom.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.

Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Hearing on June 24, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

01:35 PM Attorney Mary Cole in court.   Defendant Shamar E Smith did not appear.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern Jack Rieder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Cole states she was just retained this morning and the defendant is unable to appear today as he is sick.  Attorney Cole is asking for a short adjournment.  The State has no objection.  The Court will set this matter back for status of prelim.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for June 24, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

CONDITIONS MODIFIED 05/24/2022:  Court removes WCS as a condition of bond.

PREVIOUS CONDITIONS:  Defendant to have no contact with victims/Ulta Beauty/Parlor Salon/Hair Solutions and Spa/New Berlin Verizon Store listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Defendant not to use or possess any personal identifying information other than their own, including financial transaction cards.  Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms.

02:51 PM Defendant Shamar E Smith in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court has received notice from WCS requesting to remove pre-trial supervision as he currently resides out of State.  State has not objection to removing WCS.  Court will remove WCS as a condition of bail.  Defendant states he is currently in the process of retaining an attorney, Mary Cole.  The Court notes to defendant that attorney Cole is not licensed to practice in the State of Wisconsin.  The Court will adjourn for an additional status of counsel date.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for June 14, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
